channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@ankahajkova @OtherJayGeller Also: All the covers look like Photoshop montages rather than original illustration. Which means your titular girl has to be available on https://t.co/403NCrVD9X or your preferred source for stock photography. Which probably don’t have that many photos of girls in 1940s garb.
@ankahajkova @OtherJayGeller And if they do have multiples, which girl will seem *most* 1940s to you and the editor? Why, the one you once saw on another Holocaust book.

@bernstein_judah Of course, as befits someone who affiliated with the putschist Claremont Institute, he ignores the difference between a university holding its employees to a different standard than its independent student groups.
@ShammaBoyarin The Hertz Chumash was full of them. Sadly, it was also full of ethical admonitions, so had to be replaced following the election of Ronald Reagan.
@DrZackaryBerger He says what people with money want to hear. Always a sure path to success.
@EricaWarner16 I'd like to see his stooping to signing books in a supermarket as a sign that the wicked can get punished in this life too.
@AlderCheems @egavactip Looks like a ZIMA knockoff. Probably made by the folks behind RC Cola. Not there’s anything wrong with that.
@yourfriendbird7 Seems like a solution, at least in the short term.
@egavactip The fact we remember Zima but don’t v drink it says something about branding, though I’m not sure what.
@agraybee @Kirblar024 And Macron did it without Iranian help!
@LemieuxLGM Say more!
@protecttruth_ Leadership and prestige has historically come through the overseas bureaus. We are all between Beirut and Jerusalem now.

@N_S_Dolkart I never wrote up the event, so I don’t remember the details, but I think this was a couple years after the primary, he was pushing a children’s book, and the supermarket owner had given to the campaign.
@N_S_Dolkart Not to be confused with the time a disgraced former Israeli chief rabbi affixed a mezuzah to a different NJ synagogue.
@dave_kearn @MollyJongFast Very much so. He deserves far worse than a pathetic book signing. But at least he got that.
@rubybeans2 @MollyJongFast Nor go on to be perhaps the first thrice married ambassador to the Vatican!
Say what you want about Newt, but I’ve never seen another former House Speaker sign childrens books in a New Jersey kosher supermarket. https://t.co/cA5EtykgbO
@MollyJongFast Say what you want about Newt, but I’ve never seen another former House Speaker sign childrens books in a New Jersey kosher supermarket.
@NoahShachtman @RollingStone A few what? Minutes? Days? Months?
@JeffreyASachs The fact you didn’t confess to either killing an elderly neighbor lady or rigging a student council election makes me doubt the accuracy of your transcript.
@emptywheel “Human extinction poses challenge to Republican messaging, some say.”

Your occasional reminder that “traditional Christian family values” involve burning members of my (extended) Jewish family to death. https://t.co/DOB13lmCKz
Let me know when Ross Douthat or any of the other trad cryptofascists on salary at the Times or the National Review or First Things come up with a heuristic to determine when government support of religion is good versus when it is bad.
@Alumna_Vassar @soledadobrien I hope Ross Douthat’s soon-to-be-ex wife is more interesting and less facile.
@GailLabovitz @TheRaDR So the perfect magazine columnist! (Other than not speaking English, and being dead lo these 1500 years or so….)
@onthemainline And then what happened?
We’ll know when there’s really a “New Middle East” when Arab media start releasing election projections embargoed by Israel’s similar Election Day laws. https://t.co/7jKlhgJdnW
Sure, their positions may be objectively ridiculous. But they are lionized by institutions like Yeshiva University and the Jewish Week. https://t.co/9HJ2ViTrH1
